name: Student Association for Environmental Justice and Health Equity ðŸ’™
description:
We blend cutting-edge research, policy analysis, and hands-on activism to tackle the pressing environmental issues of our time and their impacts on community health. Through producing digital archives that promote environmental research, engaging with local politics, prioritizing community outreach, and assisting with environmental clean-up efforts, we are here to make a difference in our local and global communities. Plus, we team up with various environmental organizations to engage in conservation research and education events, giving you the chance to network and gain real-world experience in the intersection of environmental research, policy, and activism!

A few plans for 2024-2025 include...

  • Community science projects with NOAA
  • Workshops on how to engage with local and global environmental politics 
  • Digital archives that highlight student research and also keep people informed on current environmental issues
  • Collaborations with UC Berkeley environmental clubs and organizations
  • Environmental Hackathon
  • Collaborations with the UC Disaster Resilience Network (e.g. Disaster Resilience Day, Speaker series, etc)
  • Present community research at local conferences
  • Maintain a foundation of community within SAEJHE through various club activities/trips
  • ...and much more!

Anyone and everyone is welcome to be a member of SAEJHEâ€“we have no application requirements beyond filling out our interest form linked below! We also have available leadership opportunities starting fall 2024. We'll be posting up-to-date information on our instagram (@saejhe.berkeley)â€“keep an eye out for our first info sessions!
summary: SA-EJHE aims to empower students to connect environmental justice and health equity by investigating the science behind environmental determinants of health and advocating in fair and just practice.
